o35.name: Eye Care Documentation Template
o35.description: The Veterans Health Administration seeks to further standardize eye care data output from routine clinical documentation in support of quality clinical care delivery, performance improvement, interoperability across health care platforms, and clinical research activities. Prototype work has been done in both the DoD/VA Vision Center of Excellence (Optimal Vision Care Prototype) and the VA (Eye Care SmartForm) to define eye care documentation requirements and to promote standardized data output. While not yet implemented in the VA, this draft documentation template content goes a step farther than earlier projects by conforming to HL7 standards for clinical decision support, furthering the aim of an easily shareable tool with shareable data output from routine clinical documentation.

b57.name: Cardiology: Electrophysiology Consult
b57.description: The “Cardiology Consult Request/Composite” knowledge artifact is intended to harmonize and integrate related knowledge artifacts (documentation template and order sets) to facilitate referral to cardiology for stable adult patients who present to primary care with atrial fibrillation/atrial flutter, supraventricular tachycardia (SVT), bradycardia, near syncope, syncope or other arrhythmias.  The intent is to ensure that information required by the consulting specialist is available for the consultation, both by provision of historical data in the documentation template and by facilitating appropriate workup and treatment using the order sets. This context excludes emergent patients (unstable arrhythmias).

b12.name: Cardiology: Electrophysiology (EP): Other Order Set
b12.description: The “Other (Arrhythmia) Order Set” knowledge artifact is intended to support clinicians referring stable adult patients to cardiology who present with arrhythmias not specifically included in other arrhythmia order sets.  The objective of this knowledge artifact is to ensure that a minimum workup is initiated prior to a cardiology consultation.  Orders for imaging, electrocardiogram, laboratory studies, and medications that may be desired or required before cardiology consultation are included.

b8.name: Cardiology: Electrophysiology (EP): Syncope/Bradycardia Order Set
b8.description: The “Bradycardia/Syncope/Presyncope Order Set” knowledge artifact is intended to support primary care clinicians referring stable adult patients to cardiology who present with bradycardia or syncope/presyncope.  The objective of this knowledge artifact is to ensure that a minimum workup is initiated prior to a cardiology consultation.  Orders for imaging, electrocardiogram, laboratory studies, and medications that may be desired or required before cardiology consultation are included. This context excludes emergent patients (unstable arrhythmias).

b6.name: Cardiology: Electrophysiology (EP): Atrial Fibrillation/Atrial Flutter Order Set
b6.description: The “Atrial Fibrillation-Atrial Flutter Order Set” knowledge artifact is intended to support primary care clinicians referring stable adult patients to cardiology who present with atrial fibrillation or atrial flutter.  The objective of this knowledge artifact is to ensure that a minimum workup is initiated prior to a cardiology consultation.  Orders for imaging, electrocardiogram, laboratory studies, and medications that may be desired or required before cardiology consultation are included. This context excludes emergent patients (unstable arrhythmias).

b7.name: Cardiology: Electrophysiology (EP): Supraventricular Tachycardia (SVT) Order Set
b7.description: The “Supraventricular Tachycardia (SVT) Order Set” knowledge artifact is intended to support primary care clinicians referring stable adult patients to cardiology who present with supraventricular tachycardia.  The objective of this knowledge artifact is to ensure that a minimum workup is initiated prior to a cardiology consultation.  Orders for imaging, electrocardiogram, laboratory studies, and medications that may be desired or required before cardiology consultation are included. This context excludes emergent patients (unstable arrhythmias).

b36.name: Cardiology: Electrophysiology (EP) Documentation Template
b36.description: The “Documentation Template (Arrhythmias)” knowledge artifact is intended to support primary care clinicians referring stable adult patients to cardiology who present with atrial fibrillation/atrial flutter, supraventricular tachycardia (SVT), bradycardia, near syncope, syncope or other arrhythmias needing evaluation by cardiology.  The objective of this documentation template is to ensure that required historical clinical data is provided to the consulting cardiologist.   This context excludes emergent patients (unstable arrhythmias).
b36.copyright: Copyright © 2018 Veterans Health Administration, Department of Veterans Affairs. All rights reserved. Contributions from external parties are property of respective copyright holders.
b36.contributions:
Bruce Bray, MD, Professor, Cardiovascular Medicine, University of Utah School of Medicine; Staff Cardiologist, Salt Lake City VA Medical Center

o12.name: Recommended Immunizations Rule
o12.description: The intent of the “Recommended Immunizations Rule” knowledge artifact is to facilitate identification of adult patients in need of immunizations, and to activate appropriate order sets and guidelines.

o12.cautions: THE CLINICAL CONTENT IN THIS DOCUMENT IS NOT DIRECTLY SUITABLE FOR CLINICAL USE AS PRESENTED SINCE IT HAS NOT BEEN TESTED IN A CLINICAL ENVIRONMENT. IT HAS NEVER BEEN PILOTED, NEVER 100% REPRESENTS THE INTENT OF THE CLINICAL SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS, AND MAY CAUSE HARM IF APPLIED AS-IS. THIS WORK IS MADE AVAILABLE WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY WHATSOEVER, AND WITHOUT CLAIMS, EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

o10.name: Women's Health: Reproductive Health Rule
o10.description: The intent of the “Reproductive Health Rule” knowledge artifact is to prompt providers to have conversations with women of reproductive age to assess their: pregnancy and lactation status; ability to conceive; desire to be pregnant now and in the future; method of pregnancy avoidance when pregnancy is not desired.  The rule contains logic for activating related documentation templates or order sets.

o11.name: Cardiology: Inpatient Heparin Anticoagulation Protocol Rule
o11.description: The “Inpatient Heparin Anticoagulation Protocol Rule” is intended to facilitate identification of inpatients requiring therapeutic anticoagulation management and initiate actions for anticoagulation management in conditions for which unfractionated intravenous (IV) heparin is indicated. The primary focus is on therapeutic anticoagulation with unfractionated intravenous heparin for patients with Venous thromboembolism (VTE) disease in acute care, with branches within the rules for subpopulations of patients. Within each branch, as appropriate, providers are notified and relevant order sets and guidelines are activated.

o27.name: Cardiology: Inpatient Heparin Anticoagulation Protocol Order Set
o27.description: The “Inpatient Heparin Anticoagulation Protocol Order Set” is intended to facilitate management of inpatients requiring therapeutic anticoagulation management in conditions for which unfractionated intravenous (IV) heparin is indicated, as determined by the “Inpatient Heparin Anticoagulation Protocol Rule”. The primary focus is on therapeutic anticoagulation with unfractionated intravenous heparin for patients with Venous thromboembolism (VTE) disease in acute care, with branches within the order set for subpopulations of patients. Within each branch, as appropriate, orders will include nursing orders and protocols, unfractionated intravenous heparin protocol (including dose and timing adjustments), and patient body weight and other measures needed to guide therapy.

b47.name: General E-Consult Documentation Template
b47.description: The intent of the “General E-Consult Documentation Template” is to facilitate 'E-consults', in which the consulting provider does not see the patient in person, but rather reviews the patient’s clinical data as available in the electronic record system and as provided by the requesting provider, and renders a consultative opinion about the patient back to the treating clinician.

b44.name: Documentation Template Consult Request: Diagnostic Breast Imaging
b44.description: The intent of the “Documentation Template Consult Request: Diagnostic Breast Imaging” knowledge artifact is to support clinical providers in follow-up on diagnostic breast imaging orders.  Follow-up includes:  Review of prior films; review of additional imaging, unilateral and bilateral (mammography, ultrasound, and MRI); review of prior pathology; review of additional breast biopsies; consult request for evaluation and management, to surgeon, interventional radiologist, or oncologist; scheduling follow up.

o9.description: The intent of the “Diagnostic Breast Imaging Rule” knowledge artifact is to provide rule logic for alerting clinical providers and/or their proxies (other providers, mammography coordinators, coordinators) regarding appropriate next steps for a patient they are managing subsequent to abnormal breast imaging results, breast symptoms, or abnormal clinical breast findings.

b65.name: Diagnostic Breast Imaging Consult Request/Composite
b65.description: The intent of the “Diagnostic Breast Imaging Consult Request/Composite” is to harmonize and integrate related knowledge artifacts (documentation template and order set) for patients whose need for specialty consultation is identified, by screening or diagnostic breast imaging or clinical assessment.  Included are consult orders for review of outside breast imaging [mammography, ultrasound, and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)], for pathology, and for breast consultation services within and outside of VA.

b58.name: Cardiology: Pre-Op Risk Assessment Composite
b58.description: The Cardiology “Pre-Op Risk Assessment Composite” knowledge artifact is intended to harmonize and integrate related knowledge artifacts (documentation template and order set) to facilitate referral to cardiology for primary care patients who require preoperative medical clearance prior to non-cardiac surgery. This consult request as well as the associated documentation template and order set components are intended to ensure that a cardiology consultation is appropriate and, if so, that required historical clinical information is provided, and that the necessary workup is initiated prior to a cardiology consultation for a preoperative evaluation. Specific constraints for these artifacts are that the artifacts:  Apply to outpatients undergoing elective, non-cardiac surgery; Are not appropriate for use for patients with acute coronary syndrome (ACS); Are not appropriate for use for patients requiring emergency surgery

b13.name: Cardiology: Pre-Op Order Set
b13.description: The Cardiology “Pre-Op Order Set” is intended for clinical providers caring for adult patients in a Primary Care Clinic who require referral to a cardiologist for preoperative medical clearance prior to non-cardiac surgery, subsequent to determination during use of an associated documentation template that the patient requires this evaluation. This order set component is intended to ensure that the necessary workup is initiated prior to a cardiology consultation for a preoperative evaluation. Specific constraints for this artifact are that it:  Applies to outpatients undergoing elective, non-cardiac surgery; Is not appropriate for use for patients with acute coronary syndrome (ACS); Is not appropriate for use for patients requiring emergency surgery

b37.name: Cardiology: Pre-Op Risk Assessment Documentation Template
b37.description: The Cardiology “Pre-Op Risk Assessment Documentation Template” is intended for clinical providers caring for adult patients in a Primary Care Clinic who require referral to a cardiologist for preoperative medical clearance prior to non-cardiac surgery. This documentation template is intended to ensure that a cardiology consultation is appropriate, and to facilitate documentation by the referring provider of historical clinical information required by the cardiologist. Specific constraints for this artifact are that it:   Applies to outpatients undergoing elective, non-cardiac surgery; Is not appropriate for use for patients with acute coronary syndrome (ACS); Is not appropriate for use for patients requiring emergency surgery

o16.name: Primary Care: Anaphylaxis Treatment Protocol Order Set
o16.description: The intent of the “Anaphylaxis Treatment Protocol Order Set” is to facilitate initiation of appropriate orders for follow-up after an anaphylactic event. The order set includes appropriate follow-up of a stable adult patient with a recent diagnosis of anaphylaxis, including allergy consult, epinephrine auto-injector (Epi-Pen), and epinephrine auto-injector training device.

o18.name: Cardiology: Pre-Cardiac Catheterization Order Set
o18.description: The “Pre-Cardiac Catheterization Order Set” knowledge artifact is intended for clinical providers caring for adult patients in a Cardiology Clinic who are undergoing cardiac catheterization. This order set is intended to provide common orderable items for pre-catheterization care.  Specific constraints for this artifact are that: It applies to outpatients undergoing an elective procedure; It excludes patients with known Acute Coronary Syndrome (ACS); It excludes patients requiring emergency surgery

o30.name: Cardiology: Cardiac Catheterization Documentation Template
o30.description: The “Cardiac Catheterization Documentation Template” knowledge artifact is intended for clinical providers caring for adult patients who are undergoing cardiac catheterization. The documentation template is intended to ensure that appropriate data elements are captured prior to and immediately following cardiac catheterization. Specific constraints for this artifact are that:  It applies to outpatients undergoing an elective procedure; It excludes patients with known Acute Coronary Syndrome (ACS); It excludes patients requiring emergency surgery

o37.name: Mental Health: Post-traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) Screening and Assessment Documentation Template
o37.description: The intent of the “Post-traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) Screening and Assessment Documentation Template” is to support documentation of findings and decisions from screening for posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), including brief annual primary care screening, as well as follow-up evaluation using the full PTSD checklist or mental health specialty evaluation.

b10.name: Cardiology: Electrophysiology (EP): Pacemaker/Implantable cardioverter-defibrillator (ICD) Follow Up Order Set
b10.description: The “Pacemaker/Implantable Cardioverter-defibrillator (ICD) Follow Up Order Set” knowledge artifact is intended to support clinicians referring adult outpatients to electrophysiology who have previously received an ICD, CRT (cardiac resynchronization therapy), or a similar device, and who are not currently followed by electrophysiology.  Orders for imaging, electrocardiogram, and laboratory studies that may be desired or required before electrophysiology consultation are included.

b11.name: Cardiology: Electrophysiology (EP): Pacemaker/Implantable cardioverter-defibrillator (ICD) Generator Change Order Set
b11.description: The “Pacemaker/Implantable Cardioverter-defibrillator (ICD) Generator Change Order Set” knowledge artifact is intended to support clinicians referring adult outpatients to electrophysiology who have previously received an ICD, CRT (cardiac resynchronization therapy), or a similar device, and have been identified, outside of routine electrophysiology follow-up, as candidates for a generator change based upon the patient's records or history.  Necessary historical information about the device is captured in the consult order, and orders for imaging, electrocardiogram, and laboratory studies that may be desired or required before electrophysiology consultation are included.

b9.name: Cardiology: Electrophysiology (EP): Primary Prevention Implantable cardioverter-defibrillator (ICD) Implant Order Set
b9.description: The “Implantable Cardioverter-defibrillator (ICD) Order Set” knowledge artifact is intended to support cardiologists referring adult outpatients to electrophysiology who are at increased risk of sudden cardiac death and under consideration for implantable cardioverter-defibrillators (ICD) or cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) devices.  Orders for imaging, electrocardiogram, and laboratory studies that may be desired or required before electrophysiology consultation are included.

o26.name: Women's Health: Osteoporosis Screening Order Set
o26.description: The intent of the “Osteoporosis Screening Order Set” is to facilitate care of outpatient women who are due for osteoporosis screening, age>= 18 years, with no documented history of osteopenia/osteoporosis.  Orders include laboratory testing, imaging studies, patient and caregiver education, and consults and referrals.

o33.name: Primary Care: General Clinical Note - History and Physical Exam Documentation Template
o33.description: The intent of the “General Clinical Note - History and Physical Exam Documentation Template” is to facilitate documentation of information obtained during an initial primary care new patient visit. The documentation template includes the following sections: Chief complaint, history of present illness, review of systems, sexual assault, annual screening questionnaire, and health literacy assessment.

b16.name: Neurosurgery: Radiculopathy (Lumbar Thoracic) Order Set
b16.description: The intent of the “Radiculopathy (Lumbar Thoracic) Order Set” is to support users caring for adult patients who may require a Neurosurgery referral for surgery for lumbar/thoracic radiculopathy.  The intent is to ensure a minimum workup is initiated prior to a Neurosurgery Consultation.

b1.name: Gastroenterology: Colorectal Cancer Risk Rule
b1.description: The intent of the Colorectal Cancer Risk Rule is to identify patients for whom colorectal cancer screening, diagnostic evaluation, or surveillance is recommended, and to facilitate appropriate actions in concert with ordering a gastroenterology consult.  Actions may include including activating documentation templates or order sets specific to multiple different categories of patients.

b41.name: Neurology: Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) Documentation Template
b41.description: The intent of the “Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) Documentation Template” is to provide information from the referring provider to the consulting specialists, for a number of consults relevant to the management of TBI patients.  This documentation template is used in conjunction with another one used for the TBI screening itself, which also supplies information to the consulting specialists.  This template supplies information specific to the consult request process, and is completed automatically, only when the referring provider has indicated intention to consult relevant specialties in the “TBI Screening Documentation Template”.

b5.name: Cardiology: Chest Pain/Coronary artery disease (CAD) Order Set
b5.description: The “Chest Pain (CP) / Coronary Artery Disease (CAD) Order Set” knowledge artifact is intended to ensure that all appropriate workup and treatment occur before consultation with cardiology is requested for adult patients with stable CP (with or without known CAD).  The order set is intended to be presented subsequent to completion of a documentation template that provides structured historical information required by the consulting cardiologist. This context excludes emergent patients (new/ongoing/unstable pattern CP). Included are those patients with stable CP with or without known CAD, to be considered for evaluation by cardiology.

b56.name: Cardiology: Chest Pain (CP) / Coronary Artery Disease (CAD)
b56.description: The “Chest Pain (CP) / Coronary Artery Disease (CAD) Consult Request/Composite” knowledge artifact is intended to harmonize and integrate related knowledge artifacts (documentation template and order set) to facilitate referral to cardiology for adult patients with stable CP (with or without known CAD).  The intent is to ensure that information required by the consulting specialist is available for the consultation, both by provision of historical data in the documentation template and by facilitating appropriate workup and treatment using the order set.

b35.name: Cardiology: Chest Pain/Coronary artery disease (CAD) Documentation Template
b35.description: The “Chest Pain (CP) / Coronary Artery Disease (CAD) Documentation Template” knowledge artifact is intended to assist primary care providers with structured documentation in the context of referral of adult patients with stable CP (with or without known CAD) to cardiology.  The intent is to ensure that information required by the consulting specialist is available for the consultation.  In addition, the template aids in determining when a routine cardiology consultation is appropriate, and provides a link to an order set to ensure that all appropriate workup and treatment occur before consultation with cardiology is requested.   This context excludes emergent patients (new/ongoing/unstable pattern CP). Included are those patients with stable CP with or without known CAD, to be considered for evaluation by cardiology.

b4.name: Mental Health: Iraq & Afghanistan Post-Deployment Screen - Reminder to Perform Screening Rule
b4.description: The intent of the “Iraq & Afghanistan Post-Deployment Screen Reminder Rule” is to facilitate identification of patients requiring screening post-deployment to Iraq & Afghanistan for mental health, social, and physical problems arising from their deployment.  Actions may include activating a related documentation template or order set.
